alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Marion; Morrow; Richland; Wyandot (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 5:01PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Richland, northern Marion, Wyandot, northeastern Morrow and Crawford Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 501 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Shelby to 6 miles northwest of Bucyrus to near Dunkirk. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mansfield, Bucyrus, Upper Sandusky, Galion, Shelby, Ontario, Lexington, Crestline, Plymouth, New Washington, Morral, Chatfield, Marseilles, Benton, Nevada, Lucas, Wharton, Tiro, North Robinson and Harpster. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for north central and northwestern Ohio.
